raw_entry:
COL. EDWARD HILL, 3060 acs.,
King & Queen Co; far up in the freshes
of Pamunkcy Riv; 25 Oct. 1695, p. 1.
Beg. ac Jang taken by Col. William
Claybourn in b.alf of one of his
children; up the river, co FIill’s Cr., &e.
Imp. of 102 ners: Thomas Wiiks,
Edwd. Major, Tho, Heyward, Wolter
S:inson, Join Benson, Jno. Smood, John
Allen, Mary Morris, Richd. Harp, John
Hyde, Robert Jones, Mary Jones, Robert
Clore, Tho, Bottomly, Humphrey Payden,
James Hall, Huldsy Spced, James James,
Geo. Marler, Willin. Philins, Marma.
Beckwise, Edwd. Robinson, Mary Young,
Wm. Moly, Tho. Collinge, Mary Debson, Wm. Hollyman, Eliza. Dame,
Dorcas Jones, Fra. Felly, James Becmes,
Mary Cooper, Roger Norton, Wm.
Rogers, Tho. Penton, Jno. Larrcnee,
Geo. Day, Martha Weicht, Herbs.
Miargerom, Alice Fuller, Eliza. Stevens,
Wm. Simonds, Jno. Hewson, W'm.
Burnett, Alex, Nicholson, Margt, Rooksby, Mary Macklemore, Richd. Armson,
Edwd. Jenings, Cath, Hackwell, Wm,
Bene (or Besse), Wm. Salsbury, Dunken.
Mackay, Tho Haslewood, Edwd. Joyner,
Wm. Price, Jno. Evedin, Jno. Barber,
Proveess Milton, Wm, Coleman, Richd.
Lee, Rebecka Frame, Jno. Steward, Tho.
White, Wm. Bess, Eliza. Bell, Geo.
Hewson, Bridget Spcere, Ino. Smith,
Wm. Cooper, Martin Holdworth, Ja.
Bingley, Edwd. Arnefroe, Edwd. Wilson, Jer. Baley, Ino. Price, Richd.
Hughs, Mich, Talbot, Edwd. Kennon,
Rede. Wilson, Ino. Barnes, Alex. Ayer,
Tho. Hoover, David Bowen, Ino. Ensell
(or Eusell), Garrce Warren, Jno. Green,
Owen Putrick, Ino. Jubb, Robe. Seanly,
Wm. Cobut, Ellen Rich, Col. Hill,
Peter Goodrich, Richd. a Carpenter, Jno.
Byass, Henry Fells, Jane Morris, Rebecka Comish; 3 Negroes. Note: Surtendered up in Genll, Coure, 28 Qct.
8696, Test: R, Beverley, Cl. Gen, Cr.

CAPT. WILLic S RANDOLPH,
2926 acs., Chas. City Co cn Wynoatke
Por; on Piacon Sw., on S. 2.2. of James
Riser, 25 Ock. 1695, ©. 2. imp. of 39
pers: Tho, Combaron WN cholas May,
Wm. Jescup, Ande. Martin, Sami.
Courser, Jno. Garces, Weiter Squire,
Tho. Bevill, Geo. Cocncili, Job ‘
Tho. Lyborn, Peter Prous, Tane Borer,
Robt, Beazics, Joha Wit, fesa White.
Alice , Par. Foster, Rober, Povcy,
Jno. Edwaris, Gill Fucser, Tho.
Mathews, Henry Baframore, Fra. Cicave
Jey, ti.gh Davies, Jno, Herbert, Eliza.
Harrisoa, Renerta Clause, Aane Newton,
Rebeocka Bolliff, Saml. Wrighe, Macy
Jones, Owen Jones, Joha Morris, Wm.
Warren, Richd. Whceelhousc, Tho. Mertit, Ino. Evans; & 20 Negrocs.* Note:
Surreadered up in Genll. Cs. 15 Oct.
1696,

DENNIS MORRIS. 300 acs., Accomack Co; oa a marshy Island, neae
Oyster Cr., in Assetcaz Inlet, bet.
Jengoteag & Asscteag Islands; 25 Oct.
1695, p. 3. Granted John Morris, 28
Apr. 1691, desereed, & now granted
by order, &c. Imm, of 6 ners: Faith
Clark, Ino. Orchard, Jao. Jones, Jno.
Robinson, Joseph Palmer; Jack a slave,

EDWARD GUTHRY, 753 acs., King
& Queen Co; ae the mouth of Mattapony Riv., 25 Oct. 1695, p. 3. On the
maine sw. of Pepettico Cr; by the
Ferry Road; by Mr. Richard Gregory's
land & crecke; & along Mattapony &
Yorke Rivers, &¢. 300 acs. granted
Richard Major, 17 Jan. 1649; 300 acs.
ercnted Edward Simpson, 4 Dec, 1654;
84 acs. sranted sd. Simpson, 24 Apr.
1669; 69 acs. overolush, due for trans.
of 2 ners: Moria, & George.

TOBIAS MICKLEBURROUGH, 217
acs., Middlesex Co., 25 Oct. 1695, p.
4. Beg. on a br. of Corbin’s, alias
Burnham’s, Cr; to John Nash’s plantation; &c. 200 acs. granted Thomas
Pattison, 2 June 1657 & conveyed to
John Bewfoot, 17 Sept. 1659, who conveyed to Moses Buffrey, who conveyed
to Edmund Mickleborough, 16 Feb.
1664; 17 acs. overplush, due for Imp.
of: William Jones.

SAME. 515 acs., same Co. & date;
page 5. Beg. on a br. of Corbin’s, alias
Copeland’s, Cr; adj. Robert Chowning;
& land of Robert Price, dec’d., &c. 500
adj. land of Dennis Conners & Evan
1658, & granted to his dau. Grace
Lewis (now wife of sd. Tobias), 21
Oct. 1684; 15 acs. now taken, due for
Imp. of: Rachell Savekur,

SAME. 300 acs., same Co., date, &
page. Beg. at up. side of Obert’s Cr;
adj. land of Dennis Conners& Evan
Davis; along the White Marsh, to
Bertram Obert, &c. 190 acs. granted
Richard Lewis, 2 Feb. 1662, being first
gtanted to William Brocas, 18 Nov.
1653, who sold to Sir Henry Chichley,
Knt., who sold to sd. Lewis; 110 acs.
overplush, for Imp. of 3 pers: Wm.
Gentleman, Jac. Grant, James

MR. BARTHOLOMEW FOWLER,
600 acs., Middlesex Co; on head of
Nimcock Cr; beg. at Holobush Sw.
Creeke, &c; 25 Oct. 1695, p. 6. Granted John Custis, 5 Mar, 1662, deserted,
& now granted by order &c. Imp. of
12 pers: Richard Hall, Margt. Morgan,
Nicho. Titchcome, Tho. Roberts, Anne
Medows, Henry Stephens, Wm. Jones;
Toney, Tomboy, Pompey, Jone, Diana,
Negroes.

MR, EDWIN THACKER, of Middlesex Co., 2634 acs., Essex Co; on brs.
of Portobago, Cockelshell Cr., & Tuckahoe; 25 Oct. 1695, p. 7. Adj. Cornelious Wood; & John Amis; on br. of
Occupation, &c. Imp, of 53 pers: John
Dick, Henry Basford, Eliza. Sebright,
Wm. Hawkins, James Shurley, Jno.
Sherrick, Peter Simpson, Henry Carver.
Sarah Johnson, Mary Grant, Edwd.
Rowsey, Saml. Rogers, Ja. Blanchard,
Peter Cornwell, Jno. Ellis, Nicho.
Fairwether, Tho. Sanders, Peter Foster,
Jno. Abbott, Saml, Anderson, Rachel]
Johnson, Sarah Man, Hanneh Richeson,
Eliza. Dew, Martha Szockwell; & 7
Negroes*; Tamady, Juno, Flora, Roger,
Sampson, Dido, Jenny, Mall, Curro,
Dan, Tom, Mingo, Jack, Die, Peter,
Jenny, Will, Hector, Felix, Guy,
Namadi; (Negroes ?).

MR. BARTHOLOMEW FOWLER,
238 acs., K. & Q. Co;.25 Oct. 1695, p.
8. Beg. at Mr, John Coleman, on a br.
of Asseway Mansecock Sw; to good
ground supposed to belong to Mr.
Brereton; &c, Granted Stephen Benbridge, 23 Apr. 1688, deserted, & now
granted by order &c. Imp. of 5 pers:
Alex. Menny, James Hughs, James
Gregg, Jno. Gregg, Robt. Nicholson;

COL, RICHARD JOHNSON, 32835
acs., K. & Q. Co., in Pamunkey Neck;
on both sides of Goodwin or Monkewin
Sw., next above Thomas Bray, Richard
Gissedge, & James Minge, 25 Oct. 1695,
p. 8. Imp. of 66 pers: Richard Johnson, Jno, Alderidge, Richd, Blake, Dan.
Robinson, Grace Grant, Eliz. Blacket,
Jane Young, Beatrice , Walcutt
, Wm. Greensland, Tho. Felter,
Tho. Minstrell, Fra. Stone, Robert
Knight, Jer. Taylor, Hen. Smith, Jno:
Willis, Wm. Sims, James Adams, Anne
Lucy, Jane Lucy, Adam Tapskill, James
Johnson, Wm. Higen, Wm, Lacy, Wm.
Taylor, Robt. Cropley, Anne Dodson,
Robt. Sercey (or Servey), Laughland
-——, Slatery ——, Wm. Lacy, Dorothy
Jackson, Henry Yard, Richard Johnson,
Susana Johnson, Esther Birkenhead,
Susana Burfurd, Robert Duglis, Mary
, Sarah Kendall, John Ebenezer
Hanot, Thomas Davis, Thomasin Days
son, John Howell, Mary Edling, Rachelf
Greenwood, Abrahm' Wiltray; & 18
Negroes.* Note: Surrendered in the
Genll. Ct, 15 Oct. 1696. Test: R.
Beverley,

MARGARET TODD & FRANCIS
TODD, Orphants of Mr. William
Todd; 500 acs., K. & Q. Co., in Stratten Major Par., on Peanketank Sw; adj.
David Bram; 25 Oct. 1695, p. 10.
Granted George Burge, 16 Apr. 1683,
deserted, & granted Henry Wareing, 20
Oct, 1689, deserted, & granted William
Todd, 29 Apr. 1693; now surveyed according to the first survey made by Col.
John Lewis; due by order, &c,

MR. JOHN SMITH, SENR., 228
acs. Middlesex Co., 25 Oct. 1695, p. 10,
Beg. at the Blockhouse land (now Capt.
William Daniel’s), near the Bridge
Road; to land of John Custis, dec’d;
& land of Mr, Alexander Smith, formerly Potter's. Imp. of 5 pers: Moria,
George, Robin, Betty, Meg.

RALPH WORMELEY, ESQR., Secretary of Virginia, 13,500 acs., K. & Q.
Co., in Pamunkey Neck, 25 Oct. 1695,
p. 11. Beg. at Page’s land in Goodin’s
Cr; to Pamunkey River; to Pounce’s
Cr; adj. land of Dabney; Langston; &
Capt. Bassett. Imp. of 270 pers: James
Fleming, Patr. Fleming, Martha Bright,
Isabella Cook, Richard Guy, Jno, Cutter,
Richard Bennet, Edward Morphew, Tho.
Badger, Henry Hayes, Ja. Beale, Jos.
Smallwood, Zecha, Muflin, Rich. Lakeland, Robert Markland, Jos. Stannard,
Eliza. Westencroft, Martha Harmar,
Martha Shepard, Nicho. Dolton, Jno.
Slaterne, Jno. Williams, Geo. Bevacock,
August Wright, Math. Andrews, Jno.
Capick, Jno, Whelden, Jno. Watts, Jno.
Fleming, Mary Brown, Richd. Farmer,
Simon Banks, Garrt. Fitz Gerrald, Jno.
Sheath, Wm. MaConnell, Antho. Banks,
Peter Lauguedock, Jno. Purefy, Nicho.
Love, Anne Draper, Rose Smith, Eliza.
Fossell, Cath. Frank, Anne Treble, Anne
Green, Alice Harris, Wm. Gale, Rich.
Wake, Cha. McDonnell, James Nowlen,
Wm. Jones, Owen Daley, Richd. Swan,
Tho, Messalier, Thomas Tin’ly (Tinsly
?), Jno. Smith, Doro. Sutton, Tho.
Benson, Jno. Barly, Tho. Porter, Jane
Smith, Ja. Smith, Cath. Humphrys,
Cath, Jones, Susana Smith, Margt.
Simonds, Andrew Jackson, Mary Lewis,
Wm. Richardson, Thomas Smith, Abigall
Ladyman, Tho. Greenwood, Moses
Armitage, Wm, Brewer, Jno. Roberts,
Mary Shaw, Sarah Thomas, Tho. Wormeley, Anne Jones, Jno. Meed, Jno.
Payne, Cha. Heynes, Edwd. Lymber,
Sam]. Phillips, Tho. Wells, Maret.
Deferidge, Jno. Davies, Jno. Antrabus,
Jno. Gardner, Tho, Tweedy, Tho. Scott,
Rose Holliday, Anne Furrs, Jno, Winch,
Henry Simpson, Mary Simpson, Richard
Venable, Anne Haskins, Wm. Euston,
Richd. Reynold, Henry Hans (or Haus),
James Boyle, James Bowlin, Richard
Mortis, Rich. Sharp, Wm. Evans, Wm.
Siretchly, James Morris, Edward Taylor,
Jno. Williams, Walter Tucker, Martin
Mosely, Dennis Cartee, Jno. MaClennon,
Dennis Fitzgerrard, Bryan Morphew,
Daniel Kenaday, Anne Jones, Peter
Burgesson, Thonilo Mohony, Wm.
Chevers, Bryan Doran, James Dawson,
Dennis Sullivan, Kate Rogers, Mary
Fumey (or Finney), Jno. Lyon, Wm.
Twitton, Jno. Dory, Jonathan Vaughan,
Jno. Mixon, Jno. Colleoow, Anne
Clever, Edmd. Sally, Lemuel Taylor,
Peter Goren, Geo. Rhodes, Anne Harris,
Mary Adams, Jane Chevilier, Eliza.
Chevilare, Mary Strait, Wm. Woolls,
Wm. Ophill, Geo. Green, Robt. Cheesman, Jno, Harfis, Benja. Smith, Richd.
Wilkins; Tower Hili, Songo, Nedd,
Mingo, Jemmy, Ralph, Will, Grasheer,
Captain, Robin, Jenny, Kate, Jack:
Susan, Alice, Jane, Nora, Mundina, Kirt,
Sampson, Isle Wight, Dina, Hanah,
Robin, Martha, Betty, Sarah, Bridget,
Judith, Sampsots, Pamuriky, Ned, Phillis,
Carpenter, Roger, George, Tom, Phyllis,
Peter, Jone, Jack, Mathew, Margery,
Munn, Sue, Bugoll, Cate, Robin, Betty,
Mary, Mary, Bess, James, Robin, Jenkin,
Cooper, Maria, Lucy, Lewis, Peter, Sisly,
Tho, Dick, Sarah, Tony, John, Edward,
Harry, Jeffry, Margaret, Molongo, Robin,
Sibrina, Pendas, Martha, Jack, Kate,
Buggo, Dick, Abraham, Jacob, Fortune,
Henry, Harry, Jno., Sarah, Peter,
Cooper, Fortescue, Jack, Samuel, Alice,
Ben, Jack, Wéill, Punch, Tom, Jacob,
Doll, Billy. Note: Wants 21. Notre:
Surrendered, 15 Oct. 1696. Test, R.
Beverley, Cl. Gen. Ct.

EDMOND JENINGS, ESQR., 750
acs, on S. side of Mattapony Riv; beg.
at mouth of Lower Herrin Cr., to mouth
of a br. of Gravelly Run; adj. Peter
White; Richard Yarbrough; & Foard’s
cornefeild, &c; 25 Oct. 1695, p. 13.
Imp. of 12 pers.* Note: Surrendered
15 Oct. 1696, etc,
WILLIAM WORMELEY, GENT.,
712 acs., Jas. City Co., 25 Oct. 1695,
p. 13. On E. side of Powhatan; below
Powhatan Landing, to W. side of
Drinking Sw; along Wilkins’ land; to
Honble, Col. Philip Ludwell; along Mr.
Broadribb; down .Powhatan Cr., &ec.
Imp. of 15 pers.*

MR. DANIELL PUGH, 99 acs., in
Up. Par. of Nansamond Co; on SE
side of the S. branch; 25 Oct. 1695, p.
14. Beg. on NW side of the maine
road, cor. of land formerly Col. Due’s
& Mr, Mills’; adj. lands of Spevy; Hill;
& Baker. Imp. of 2 pers: Jno, Croxton, James Douglas.

CAPT. JOHN WRIGHT, 1450 acs.,
Up. Par. of Nansemond Co; on
side of Bennett’s Cr., 25 Oct. 1695, p.
15. Beg. at Daniell Pugh; along E, side
of the Hony pott Br; crossing mouth
of the White pott Br., &c. Imp. of 29
pers: Johnson Redding, Wm. Redding,
Tho. Churchyard, Wm’ Nutto, Aler.
Nutto, Jno, Hanystall, Tho. Bradhurst,
Howell Window, Tho. Randall, Tho.
Clay, Wm. Hill, Wm. Thomas, Jane
Thomas, Henry Hendy, Lakeen Shennon,
Arth. Laderat, Jane Iren, Ja. Laphorn,
Richd. Evans, Jos. Beven, Wm. Wintlaw, Wm. Fogen, Jno. Grahger, Wm.
Curtis, Susa. Wile, Margt. Thomkins,
Richd. Evans, Saml. Goldsworth, Edwd.
Lawrance.

JOHN CORBELL, 285 acs., Up. Par.
of Nansemond Co; on &. side of the S.
br. of Nansemond Riv. called Evans’
Cr; along Mills’ Cr. &c; 25 Oct, 1695,
p. 16. Granted to John Wright in July
1653, & now in possession of Thomas
Corbell, in behalfe or of his son, the sd.
John, to whom it of right belongs, as
being the eldest son of the eldest
daughter of John Harris & Abigall, his
wife, who have had the land in peaceable & quiett possession since 1654; &
now by order of the Gen. Ct., the land
is surveyed .agcording to patent & ancient
bounds, & patented in the name of sd.
John Corbell,

WILLIAM PEAD, 40 acs., Norf. Co:
S. side of the Damms, adj. James Thejabell; 25 Oct. 1695, p. 17. 17 acs.
part of patent to Giles Collins & Thomas
Adams, 6 Jan. 1649; by Collins sold to
John Pead, 5 Mar. 1659, who bequeathed
to his son John, who dying without
issue sd. land become due to sd. William, his brother & heir at law; 29 acs.
ed taken, for Imp. of: Esther Dangereild.

JOHN WYATT, 80 acs., Norf. Co.,
25 Oct, 1695, p. 18. Near head of Capt.
Hatton’s Cr., in the W. br. of Eliz.
Riv; adj. John Frost, Jenings’ land,
John Ellett, John Hollowell, Mr.
Hodges & Richard Powell. Imp. of 2
pers: Sarah Lowder, Sam]. Elliston,

ANDREW TAYLOR, Shoemaker,
147 acs., Norf. Co; SW side of Spring's
Mill, in the W. br. of Eliz. Riv; adj.
John Freeman & Robert Spring; 25 Oct.
1695, p. 18. Imp. of 3 pers: Nicho.
Roderith, Simon Powen; Santo,

MOSES SPRING, 224 aes., Norf. Co,
SW side of the W. br. of Eliz. Riv.,
known by the name of the head of
Batile Ridge; 25 Oct. 1695, p. 19.
Imp. of 5 pers: Jno. Shouter, Lakall
Shannon, Jonathan Derith, Wm. Sneesby, Mary Bort.

JOHN HINTON, 145 acs., Up. Par.
of Nansemond Co; on part of Sumerton
Road, S. of the little Bridge; on W.
side of the maine road; 25 Oct, 1695,
p. 19. Imp. of 3 pers: Jane Battersby,
Mayworth Quinton, Jno. Sleyden.

THOMAS NOREFLEAT, JUNR., 130
acs., Up. Par. of Nansemond Co; near
Barbicue Sw; adj. his own, & Dyer’s
land; 25 Oct, 1695, p. 20. Imp. of 4
pets: Wm. Higden; Ahallo, Sarah.

WILLIAM STAFFORD, 400 acs.,
Up. Par. of Nansemond Co; 25 Oct.
1695, p. 21. Beg. at Epaphraditus Benton, on NE side of the NW br. of Cross
Swamp, neare the Wolfe Pitt plane; on
Baker’s line; neare the maine road; on
Jchn Boice, &c. Imp. of 8 pers; “Simon
Steed, Joakim Wright, Hannah Hotkly,
Walter Woden, Jane Jemmysqn, Tho.
Towers, Tharict Townly, Anne Amy.

THOMAS UNDERWOOD, 350 aes,,
Low. Par. of Is. of Wight €o; adj.
Richard Brassell; & John Silleway; 25
Oct. 1695, p. 22. Imp. of 7 pers: John
Preuit, Richard Felton, Alice Felton,
John Russer, Wm. Hilson, Will. Oakes,
John Lyddon,

GEORGE ANDREWSON, 175 acs.,
Low. Par. of Is. of Wight Co., 25 Oct.
1695, p. 22. Adj. George Pearce, John
Silleway, William Carver, William Williams, & Richard Brassell. Imp. of 4
pers: James Samson 3 times, & Eliza.
Samson, his dauchter.

WILLIAM .CARVER, 45 acs., Low.
Par. of Is. of ‘Wight Co; adj. Thomas
Mandue, & Phillib Wrayford; 25 Oct.
1695, p. 23. Imp. of: James Ashden.

JOHN PARNELL, 400 acs., Low.
Par. of Is. of Wight Co; 25 Oct, 1695,
p. 23. Adj. James Gardner; Christopher
Wade; & John Nevill; up the Durty
Branch, &c. Imp. of 8 pers: Mary
Samson twice, Tho. Cockrell, Samll.
Pally, Robt. Andersfeild & Sary his
wife, Geo. Teader, Jno, Bedford.

MAJOR JOHN NICHOLLS, 160
acs., Norf. Co; on SW side of the W.
br. of Eliz, River, 25 Oct. 1695, p. 24.Beg. on E. side of the mouth of Muddy
Cr., adj. the Widow Davnall (or
Darnall), & Rositer’s land. Granted
Robert Digby, 18 Oct. 1664, who sold
to Thomas Russell, who sold to John
Abbott, & by him sold to John Nicholls,
who sold to Edward Outlaw; then by
severall assignements from him to John
Flowers, who sold to sd. Nicholls.

MR. JOHN BILLOPS, 38 acs., Glocester Co., in Kingstone Par; at the
mouth of Wright’s Cr; adj. Mr. Tabb;
25 Oct. 1695, p. 74. Imp. of: Edward
‘Swann.

THOMAS REYNOLDS, 252. acs.,
New Kent Co., in St. Peter's Par; along
line of Wharton, to Black Cr; adj. Tho.
Snead, &c; 25 Oct. 1695, p. 25. Imp.
of 5 pers: Hagar, Sancho, Conde,
Lopez, Carlos. ~

THOMAS SNEAD, 450 acs., New
Kent Co., in St, Peter’s Par; on brs. of
Black Cr; adj. John Sandige; & land
of Hubbert; along Powhite Path, &c;
25 Oct. 1695, p, 25. Imp. of 9 pers:
Robert Couch, Geo. Poole, Roger
Hodges, Tho. Cock, Sarah Mason, ‘ho,
Rice, Eliz. Collaine, Richd. Davies,
Hannah Rhodes,

COL. ANTHONY LAWSON, 200
acs., Pr, Anne Co., in Little Creeke
Precincts; on SW side of the new road,
cor, of William Wishart; George Fowler; Hunter's; & Hatersby’s lands; 25
Oct. 1695, p. 26. Imp. of 4 pers: Tho.
Webb, Sarah Elam, Reba. Tankard, Jno.
Royston,

MR. GEORGE FOWLER, 276 acs.,
Pr. Anne Co., in Little Creeke Precincts:
at head of Brake’s Br., cor, of William
Wishart; to mouth of Ashael’s Br., &c;
25 Oct. 1695, p. 27. Granted to Capt.
Adam Thorowgood & by Adam, his
son & heir, sold to George Fowler, 1
Mar, 1658, & in possession cf the
abovenamed George, as heir of his decd:
father.

JOHN RALLS,-650 acs., Up. Par. of
Nansemond Co., near Summerton; 25.
Oct. 1695, p. 27. Beg. at Henry Copeland & William Moore on W. side of
a br. of Indian Grave Swamp Neck;
along Henry Copeland, Junr., now sd.
Ralls’ land; to More’s land; to the
Widdow Boice, & land of William
Stafford, &c. Imp. of 13 pers: Jno.
Therenot, Saml. Thomas, Saralt Sliddo,
Jno. Sliddo, Wm, Wise, Wm. Worley,
Walter Watkins, Anne Martin, Lane
Tibsill, Saml. Jay, Tho. Wootton;
Jemmy & Matto, Negroes,

CHARLES WILKS, Brickmaker, 820
acs., Up. Par, of Nansemond Co; on SE
side of Sumerton Cr., & E. side of
Beavor Dam Sw; 25 Oct. 1695, p. 29,
Imp. of 17 pers: Andr. Myson, Patr.
Okonnell, Heynder Jacony, Jno. Simp:
son, Wm. Ofell, Jno. Ofell, Hannah
Ofell, Nantidell Migro, Wm. Nanter,
Saml. Pell, Walter Sanderson, Sarah
Jacky, Geo. Gregg, Geo. Brereton,
Mary Jones; Matto & Ophir, Negroes.

CAPT. HUGH CAMPBELL, 300
acs., Pr. Anne Co., in Curratuck Precincts; being a seated plantation Capt.
Henry Gibbs purchased of Black
Charles; adj. James Heath; near Back
Bay; adj, Mr. Thomas Jackson, Daniell
Land; & the poquoson of the North
River & Cr; 25 Oct. 1695, p. 30.
Granted Capt. Henry Gibbs, Esqr., 21
Oct. 1687, deserted, & now granted by
order &c. Imp. of 6 pers: Sibbo, Jone,
Peter, Tom, young Tom, Jack.

THOMAS IVY, 450 acs., Pr. Anne
Co., 25 Oct. 1695, p. 30. Bet. head of
the E. br. of Eliz. River & head of
Bennett's Cr; adj. William Hancock.
Part of 620 acs. granted Thomas Vicesimus Ivey, his father, 23 Oct. 1673,
deserted, & now granted by order &c.
Imp. of 9 pers: Henry Sutton, Wm.
Burdall, Jno. Blake, Mary Berry, Jone
Castell, Richard Evans, Wm, Underhill,
Clemt. Sampson, Jno. Wilson.

WILLIAM MOORE, 400 acs., Pr.
Anne Co., in Linhaven Par., 25 Oct.
1695, p. 31. Beg. at Mr. Henry Woodhouse’s old land called the quarter; adj.
Gisborn’s; Dallie; Spratt; & William
Capps’ lands, &c. Granted sd. Woodhouse, 20 Oct. 1691, deserted, & now
granted by order, &c. Imp. of 8 pers:
Phill. Haman, Jno. Rumly, Cha, Cooper,
Tno. Ogelby, Nath. Walker, Jno.
Dockerty; Ibore & James, Negroes.

WILLIAM SYMMONS & JOHN
SIMMONS (Simonds), 500 acs., Surry
Co., in Southwarke Par; E. side of the
maine br. of Mr, John Barker’s reedy
sw; 25 Oct. 1695, p. 32. Granted William Symmons, their father, by order
&e., 27 Oct. 1692, as deserted by
Thomas Tyas, who obtained patent for
same 20 Oct. 1688, which sd. Symmons
being dead before patent (issued), the
land was granted the abovenamed &c.
Imp. of 10 pers.*

JOHN BRIGHT & OWEN DOUGHARTY, 300 acs., Norf. Co., 25 Oct.
1695, p. 33. Escheated from Thomas
Hall, dec’d., by inquisition under John
Lear, Esqr., Esch’r., 21 Oct. 1689, &
now granted, &c.

WILLIAM WATERS, GENT., 200
acs., Accomack Co; at head of Messango
Gr; adj. Robert Johnson; 29 Oct. 1696,
p. 33. Granted Maj, John Robins, 29
Apr. 1692, deserted, & now granted by
order, &c. Imp. of 4 Negroes: Sydon,
Sambo, Abell, Sarah.

JOHN WASHBOURNE, 644 acs.,
N’ampton Co; S. side of Pongotegue
River; adj. Charles Scarburgh’s 400 acs.,
purchased by Hugh Yeo, Merchant; on
land of Anthony Hoskins; John Robinson; & Nicholas Wadilow; 29 Oct.
1696, p. 34. Said 644 acs, being added
in a patent of 1044 acs, granted sd. Yeo,
26 Mar. 1664, deserted, & granted sd.
Washbourne, for Imp. of 13 pers:
Eliza. Grimshaw, Alice Daniel, Wm.
Waterford, Arthur Goaled, Michael
Fadler, John James, Phil, Ferne, Jack,
Mary, Mary, Sith, Dott, Tom, Negroes.

WILLIAM CHURCHHILL, GENT.,
40 acs., Middlesex Co., 29 Oct. 1696,
p- 34. Beg. at road to his house, at
Col. Christopher Wormeley’s path by
a White Marsh; cor. of Churchhill’s
Quarter land bought of William Poole.
imp. of 1 Pers.*

HENRY WILLIAMSON, GENT.,
166 acs., Essex Co., 29 Oct. 1696, p.
35. Beg. at 420 acs, granted George
Marsh, 19 Aug. 1664 & granted sd.
Williamson, 20 Sept. 1683; along Easterbee’s land; to john Jones; crossing
the Mill Sw., to Richard Grinstead.
Imp. of 4 pers.*

ROBERT BEVERLEY, GENT., 2359
acs., bet. Rappahannock Riv. & head run
of Mattapony Riv; E, on path from
Portobago Indian Town to Chicohamony
Indian Lown; W. on a great tract of
Major Robert Beverley’s; 29 Oct. 1696,
p. 35. Granted Hugh Owen, 28 Apr.
1691, deserted, & now granted by order,
&c. Imp. of 48 pers. Note: In King
& Queen Co. or Essex.

RALPH WORMELEY, ESQR., 200
acs., Middlesex Co; on run of the Great
Sw; adj. land of William Daniell &
John Smith, dec’d; David Allison &
William Downing; & Alexander Smith;
near the Dragon Swamp; 29 Oct. 1696,
p. 36. Granted Mr. Richard Robinson,
26 Sept. 1678, deserted, & granted
Edwin Conway, 28 Sept.. 1681, who
sold to sd. Wormeley, 8 Dec. 1687 &
acknowledged in Lancaster Ct, 14 Dec.
1687,

MAJOR LEWIS BURWELL, 1733
acs., if Up. part of New Kent Co., in
St. Peter’s Par; on S. side of Pamunkey
River; comon!y called Ludwell’s Necks;
adj. Beavor quarter Land; near Machumps Cr; 29 Oct, 1696, p. 37. Imp.
of 35 pers.”

HONBLE. RALPH WORMELEY,
ESQR., 3200 acs., Middlesex Co., 29
Oct. 1696, p. 38. Beg, at mouth of
Rosegill, alias Nimcock, Cr; along
Rappa, River, to land of Maj. Gen.
Robert Smith, dec’d; &c. Granted Capt.
Ralph Wormeley, 6 June 1649,

SIR WILLIAM SKIPWITH, BARRONETT, 710 acs., K. & Q. Co., 29
Oct. 1696, p, 38. Beg. at the Dragon
$w., cor. of John Richards; crossing
the Horse pen Br. 545 acs. granted Sir
Gray Skipwith, deserted, & granted Maj,
Gen, Robert Smith, 16 Apr. 1669, who
assigned to said Sir William, & granted
to him 16 Apr. 1670; 165 acs. overplist, for Imp, of 4 pers: Wm. Hawins, Richd. Straughan, Tho. Maddison,
Joe. Flanakin.

THOMAS TODD, 333 acs., K. & Q.
Co., 29 Oct. 1696, p. 39. Beg. close to
the Indian Path; on Goodrich's line;
over a br. of one of the maine brs. of
Mattapony Riv; to the Indian Land, by
Stephen West. Granted Robert Nash,
20 Oct. 1691, deserted, & granted John
Everitt, 25 Oct. 1694, who assigned to
said Todd, 17 Dec, 1694, etc.

MR. THOMAS SCOTT & JOHN
DRUMMOND, 5764 acs., upper part
of New Kent Co; on both sides the S.
br. of Pamunkey Riv: 29 Oct. 1696, p.
40. Beg. at a gutt called now Leithwater, about 6 mi. above Mankun on
same side of that gr. S, branch, by the
meanders thereof of a flexure or bent
of sd. branch called the Roundabout.
Imp. of 116 pers: Teague Oneal, Alex.
(or Alce) Cortell, Timo, Mackdonnell,
Jam. MacAlister, Jane Brook, Roger
Douty, Wm. Butt, Eliza. Collins, Jno.
Fryer, Jam. Omoonee, Sarah his wife,
Tho, Smyth, Barbara his wife, Eliza.,
Tho. their chidren; Pet, Conlomb, Tho.
Burk, Wm, Wager, Fra. & Jno. Brodhurst, Mary Reddecome, Mary Seacomb,
Wm. Welthin, Downman Johnson,
Sarah Fartell, Roger Tidley, Mary
Skizmell (or SkirmelJ), Sarah Midleton,
Benja. Hathy, Jos. Bontell, Savage
Mastor, Antho. Lemton, Tho, Franses,
Mary his wife, Tho. Margt., Mary, Jno.
& Susan their children; James Cord,
Jno. Dervich, Math. Fakite, Sarah his
daughter, Wm. Marten, Ja. Parker;
Sarah, Tidday, Sambo, Harry, Tebu,
Morat, Tomboy, Sarah, Harry, Jack,
Ned, Dillo, Hagar, Yarrow, Neddy,
Jno., Negroes; Pet. Parker, Isaac Dix,
Fellow Clere, Jno. Buckley, Nathn.
Bradford; Jack, Cate, Negroes; Anne
Michael, Wm. Deacle, Sarah Long,
Edrd. Revell, Deborah an Indian, Rich.
ard Jackson, Alex. Lewis, Robt, Lewis,
Anne Copie, Jno. West, Jno, Parker,
Jno. Burrack, Sarah Burrack, Elinor
Fisher, Tim. Hare, Jno. Belson, Owen
Mordack, Jno. French, Deborah Alson,
Wm. Bill, Roger Corbett, Jno. Richardson, Sarah Simple, Suzana Hunton, Jane
Ardent, Jane Hamell, Mary Suchan,
Honora Kelly, John West, Moses Red,
Jno. Phillips, Mary Jones, Judith
Strong, Geo. Radle, Nathaniel] Mills;
David, Alla, Sugen, Tony, Bess, Nan,
Betty, Nedd, Casar, Marcellus, Scipo,
Pompey, Frank, Sarah: Negroes.

WILLIAM COOKE, 2914 acs., Warwick Co; at head of the old Pequoson
Damms, 29 Oct. 1696, p, 41. Adj. Mr.
Collier; William Hayward: Mr. Mountford; & Garrard Ridlie. 18 acs. granted
Owen Davis, 20 Apr. 1685 & assigned
to sd. Cooke; 11%4 acs, for Imp. of:
Margt. Baley.

MR. HENRY ROYALL, 245 acs.,
Warwick Co; SW on James River; by
Faulkner's Damm; adi. land of William
Brown, dec’d., & Oswell Langly, dec’d;
29 Oct. 1696, p. 41. Imp. of 5 pers:
Jno. Hall; Bess, Moll, Joka, Jack.

MR. SAMUELL CHAPPELL, 218
acs., Warwick Co; on brs, of the E. side
of Deep Cr., 29 Oct, 1696, p. 42. Beg.
at a br. parting this & land of Richard
Jackson; adj. heirs of Richard Wooten,
John Camlyd; James Russell; heires of
Col. William Cole. 122 acs. granted
him, 21 Oct. 1684, deserted, & granted
Capt. Miles Cary 18 Apr. 1691, who
assigned to sd. Chappell; 85 acs. for
Imp. of 2 pers: Jno. Cheek, Anne
Jones.

THOMAS ALLEN, 177 acs., Eliz.
City Co; on S. side of Scon’s Damm;
29 Oct. 1696, p. 43. Beg. at a br. parting this & land of Mr. Thomas Curle,
Mercht; adj. Mr. Richard Jones, land
of Col. William Cole, dec’d., & William
Smith. 92 acs, part of 300 acs. granted
Thomas Stephens, 6 Jan. 1647, & after
severall assignments came to Richard
Allen, his father; 85 acs. granted sd.
Richard Allen, 10 Mar. 1652 & renewed
18 Mar. 1662.
_ JAMES CATHON, 53 acs., Warwick
Co., 29 Oct. 1696, p. 44. Beg. at
mouth of one of the W. brs. of the
Mill rum of Watters Cr; adj. the Widdow Norwood; & Mr, Francis Rice.
Imp. of 2 pers: Jno. Almond, Mary
Black.

THOMAS KING, 225 acs., Warwick
Co., 29 Oct. 1696, p. 44. Adj. Mr.
Samuel Chappell; Mr, Samuel Ramshir;
William Norwood; James Kathon; Mr.
Francis Rice; & Major Dudley Diggs’
land. Imp. of 5 pers: Jno. Hall, Richd.
Sanders, Wm. Lowry; Mingo & Dick.

JOHN MALLICOT (Mellicot), 11
A., 40 P., Warwick Co., 29 Oct. 1696,
p. 45. Beg. at a br. of Fisher’s Cr; adj.
Mr. William Rascow; John Edwards;
Prichard’s old feild; James Floyd; &
Mathew Jones. Imp. of: Walter Bayley.

JOHN WRIGHT, GENT., of Nansemond Co., 150 acs., at head of Dumplin
Is. Creek, a br. of Nansemond River;
adj. Tho. Francis, & Jno. Oraving (?);
29 Oct. 1696, p. 45. Granted Tho.
Francis, 21 Nov. 1654 (or 1694), deserted, & now granted by order, &c.
Imp. of 3 pers: Roger Conroth (or
Couroth), Mary Gillet, Sarah Wood.

MR. ANTHONY GREGORY, 70
acs., Glocester Co., in Kingstone Par;
adj. Charles Jones; land of Henry
Wareing, dec’d., & land formerly Me.
Roberts’, but now Mr. Tho. Todd’s; 29
Oct. 1696, p. 46. Imp. of 2 pets:
Ezekiel Reynolds, Jonathan Cocker (or
Corker).

DORCEY OATLY, 126 acs., Jas.
City Co; being an island of marsh; E.
on the lower Gulf of Chicohamony
River; 29 Oct. 1696, p. 46. Imp. of
3 pers: Appia, Sisly.

JOHN BOWERS, of Norf. Co., 166
acs., on the NW side of the W. br.
of Eliz, River; nigh Maning’s land; 29
Oct. 1696, p. 47. Part of 400 acs.
granted Tho, Meares, 1 Tune 1649, &
assigned to Robt. Bowers, 26 Mar. 1650,
after whose decease it became due to
his son, Robert, as heir at law, who by
deed of guift, 15 Feb. 1675, gave to
sd. John.

JOHN PARKER, Cooper, 87 acs., in
the Up. Par. of Nansemond Co; in the
W. br. of Nansemond River; adj.
Henry Gray; Samll. Watson; & Peter
Parker; 29 Oct. 1696, p. 47. Imp. of
2 pers: Theo. Person, Joan Woodward.

THO, CONSTANT, 600 acs., Nansemond Co., on Sumerton Run; adj. Jno,
Winborn, & Wm. Moore; 29 Oct. 1696,
p. 48. Granted Henry Copeland, 8 Oct.
1672, deserted, & now granted by order,
&c. Imp. of 12 pers: Sarah, Mingo,
Guy, Jack, Neddy, Bess, Doll, Jone,
Prue, Sambo, Abell, Jokan.

JOHN POTLINE, 38 acs., York Co.,
in New Pocoson Par; adj. his own; Jno.
Clerk; & Dozwell’s land; 29 Oct. 1696,
p. 48. Imp. of: Tho. Randy (or Raney):

ROBERT DRISDALL (Drisdale),
118 acs., Norf. Co; N. side of the W.
br, of Eliz. River, at head of Hollowell’s
land; adj. lands of Murraie; & Slaughter; 29 Oct. 1696, p. 49. Granted
Henry Hollowell, 20 Apr. 1682, deserted, & now granted by order, &c.
Imp. of 3 pers: Dodin, Simkin, Bess.

LIEUT. EDWD. ROSS, 5 rood & 7
pole in James City, whereon he dwells;
29 Oct. 1696, p. 49. From an old
ditch near head of Pitch & Tarr Sw.,
to James River, &c. Granted Jno.
Phipps, 4 May 1661, deserted, & now
granted, &c. Imp. of: Sam. Allen.

THOMAS BROWN, 170 acs., Norf.
Co; on N. side of land formerly Leuit.
Col. Brown’s; by the Indian Path, &c;
29 Oct. 1696, p. 50. Being part of
1210 acs. granted Lt. Col. Thomas
Brown, 17 June 1666, deserted, & now
granted by order &c. Imp. of 4 pers:
Soso, Doll, Cate, Nan.

JOHN HEDGPAH, SENR., 450 acs.,
Up. Par. of Nansemond Co; on W. side
of Faustus Cabin Br., out of the back
swamp of Sumerton Cr; adj. Jenkins’
land, &c; 29 Oct, 1696, p. 50. Imp. of
9 pers: Jos. Bradley, Jno. Harle, Alice
Crumpton, Luke Archer, Richd, Harper,
Robt. Harris, Tho. Hutcheson, Richd.
Littlepage, & Wm. Sims.

JOHN WHITE, 300 acs., Up. Par.
of Nansemond Co; on both sides the
head of Beavor Damm Sw; adj. Jno.
Copeland; 29 Oct. 1696, p, 51. Imp.
6 pers: William Sullivant, Jno. Pugnall, Peter Brookbank, Jno., Robt. &
Sarah Line (?).

THOMAS NESHAM  (Neesham),
168 acs., im the upper part of James
City Co; on W. side of Nickatewanees
Path; to W. side of Dockman’s run;
along Peak’s line, to James River Path
(alias Bsadford’s), &c; 29 Oct. 1696,
p. 51. Imp. of 4 pers: Thomas Taylor,
Emanl. Dees; Booty, Tony.

CAPT. WM. ARMISTEAD (Armisted), 130 acs., Eliz. City Co.; on his
father’s; & land of Jno. Parson; 29
Oct. 1696, p. 52. Imp. of 3. pers:
Harry, Domingo, Sambo.

JOHN MACCALIN (Mack Allen),
158 acs., Nansemond Co; on SW side
of the S. br., commonly called Evans’
Creek; adj. Mr. King; the maine Road,
&c; 29 Oct. 1696, p. 52. Imp. of 4
pers: Rich, Littlepage, twice.

MR. SAMUEL BUSH, of Norf. Co;
320 acs., Pr. Anne Co; on the black
pequoson, near the Beavor Damms of
the head of Indian Cr; 29 Oct. 1696,
p. 53. Adj. Tully Emperour; Owen
Willeys (or Willis); & Mr. Scot’s corn
feild. Imp. of 7 pers: Margt. Nichols,
Andrew Steward; 5 Negroes.*

DENNIS MACOY, JUNR., 100 acs.,
Norf, Co; E. side of the S. br. of Eliz.
River; 29 Oct. 1696, p. 53. Granted
Dennis Macoy, his father, 23 Oct. 1673,
deserted, & now granted by order, &c.
Imp, of 2 Negroes.*

WM. CATHERELL, 800 acs., Pr.
Anne Co; near Lucy Keeling; adj. Tho.
Cannon; & land of Cornix; on the
Western Sw., takeing in the Beech
Ridge to the Broad Run; near Mr.
Henry Spratt, cor. of Mr. Anthony
Lawson; & on lirié marked by agreement betwixt Jno. Keelin, father (of
sd. Lucy ?) & sd. Lawson, the 15 June
1677. Part of 2137 acs. granted Jno.
Keeling, 22 Nov. 1682, deserted, & now
granted by order, &c. Imp. of 16
Negroes.*

HENRY HOLLAND, 472 acs.,
Up. Par. of Nansemond Co; at head of
the back Sw. of Summerton Cr; 29 Oct.
1696, p. 55. Imp. of 10 Negroes.

ROBERT BEVERLY, 5000 acs., New
Kent Co; S. side of Pamunkey Riv., on
br. of Crump’s Cr; adj. lands of Moses
Davis & Jno. Rea; 29 Oct. 1696, p. 55.
Granted Lawr. Bathurst, 28 Apr. 1691,
deserted, & now granted by order, &c.
Imp. of 100 pers: Eliza. Davis, Mary
Loe, Giles Darbie, Jno. Mayo, Wm.
Grant, Wm. Keele, Jane Gibs (or
Giles), Maty Lott, Jno. Folke, Maudlin
Jones, Hen. Best, Senr., Robt. Briggs,
Charles Right, Henry Best, Junr.,
Hannah Griffen, Robt. Griffen, Hanna
est, Samll. Greene, Edwd. Story, Mary
Best, Samll. Vocke, Peter Goldfinch, Ed.
Woodsworth, Antho. Ballard, Tho.
Mires, Mary Wright, Tho. Cobb, Samll.
Man, Wm. Read, Alice Strange, Mary
Wilson, Ellin Wench, Eliza. Davis, Ja.
Butler, Hen. Fisher, Nath. Only, Wm.
Walter, Edwd, Wilson, Habak. Booke,
Richd, Farre, Wm. Smith, Wm. Hudson, Michael Irish, Tho, Munns, Hump.
Osborn, Wm. Tayler, Nath. Hicumbottom, John Chest, Richd. Seaman,
Samll. Chappell, Jno. Bechem, Nich.
Nox (or Noe), Gideon Peltner (or
Peltier), Jno. Bellett, Samll, Whitehead,
Mary Goslin, Jno. Ward, Jno. Allin,
Nich. Ellis, Wm. Rickuts, Roger
Bridges, Arnall Mouse, Garrett Ledwith,
Hen, Cole, Oswell Osborn, James
Barnes, Antho. Little, Kath. Little, Anne
Green, Lewis Williams, Owen Magaren,
Tho. Mason, Fran. Bumpas, Anne
Sanders, Margt. Grimleys, Tho. Stafford,
Mary Woodward, Mary Jefftyes, Tho.
Richards, Jno. Wright, Wm. Buttler,
Jno. Potter, Martha Neale, Jos. Peere
(or Peeve), Sarah Downam, Jane
Arbrey, Obadiah Pitt, Tobias Buttler;
Jack, Mary, Keate, Peter, Jean, Mingo,
Parrett, Keate, Growdy, Dick, Tom,
George, Negroes.

WM. SNEAPS (Snapes), 29 acs.,
Glocester Co., in Petsoe Par; adj. Mr.
Nicholas Smith; up the Spring Br; 29
Oct. 1696, p. 57. Imp. of: Simon
Brock.

GEO. MASH, 177 acs., Pr. Anne Co.,
in Linhaven Par; adj. Thomas Benson;
Griffin's cor; & near Jno. James; 29
Oct. 1696, p. 57. Being added in a
patent to Tho, Benson for 277 acs., 22
Nov. 1682, deserted, & now granted &c,
Imp. of 4 pers: Sibby, Kate, Donell,
John.

MR. THO. MILLER, 660 acs., Glocester Co., in Petsoe Par., 29 Oct. 1696,
p. 58. NE side of a small br, of Poplar
Spring Br; adj. Isaac Richardson; Rapphannock Road; lands of Mr. Jno.
Buckner, dec’d; Mr. Barnard,. dec’'d; &
Mr, Tho, Vicaris; a br. dividing this
& land that belonged to Tho. Wisedom, dec’'d; on John Easter's old feild,
&c. 300 acs. granted him,- 28 Oct.
1665; 270 acs. for Imp. of 6 pers: Jno.
Cawnell, Jno. Wornam, Phil. Thomas,
Wm. Sewell, Ja. Batchley, Fra, Simson.

WM. WINSTON, 2057 acs., New
Kent Co., in St. Peter’s Par., 29 Oct.
1696, p. 59. Beg. on S. side of
Crump’s Cr: along Isnd, now or JIate,
of Henry Chiles, &c. Imp. of 42 pers.*
Note: 32 by Miles Cary’s Certificate
Clk, of the Genrll. Cr.

JOHN SMITH (Smyth), 350 acs.,
Norf. Co; W. side of Simpson’s Cr.
Damms; adj. Joel Martin; in a forke
of the Cyprus Branch, &c; 29 Oct, 1696,
p. 60. Imp. of 7 Negroes.*

CAPT. HUGH CAMPBLE (Campbell), 380 acs., Is. of Wight, Co; adj.
Giles Driver; neigh Parson Braieswell;
& Ambros Bennett; 29 Oct. 1696, p.
61. Being part of 930 acs. granted
Giles Driver, 21 Sept, 1674, deserted,
& now granted by order, &c. Imp. of
8 Negroes.*

JOHN COPELAND, 300 acs., Up.
Par, of Nansemond Co; on NW side of
Beavor Dam Sw; cor. of Masen’s patent,
belonging to Wm. & Jno. Doughtree;
adj. lands of White, Maccladland -&
Perry; 29 Oct. 1696, p. 62. 150 acs.
granted Edwd. Thillwell, 24 Feb,
1675/6, who sold to Jerremiah Perry,
12 Dec. 1678, who sold to said Copeland, 12 Apr. 1679; 150 acs. for Imp.
of 3 pers: Geo. Sarband, Anne Proud,
Mary Nichols.

MR. BARTHOLOMEW FOWLER,
344 acs., Henrico Co., im Varina Par:
on N, side of James Riv., 29 Oct. 1696,
p. 62. Beg. on the middle run, bet.
Colson’s & the Deep Bottom; along
Henry Trent, to head of Barrow land;
by Mr. Pleasants, &c. Granted Mr.
Giles Webb, 29 Apr. 1692, deserted, &
now granted by order, &c. Imp. of 7
Negroes.*

PHILIP JOHNSON, 400 acs., Eliz.
City Co., 29 Oct. 1696, p. 63. Beg at
a br. of Broad Cr; to Jno, Cotton; adj.
Mr, Parson’s land called Harrises'
Quarter; mear Capt. Anthony Armsted
(Armistead). 50 acs, granted Marke
Johnson, his father, 4 Oct. 1639; 198
acs. granted sd, Mark, 31 July 1645
(or 1695); 152 acs., found within, due
for Imp. of 4 pers: James Baley, Jno.
Baley, Tho. Farmer, Jno. Hooke.

CAPT. HUGH CAMPBELL, 530
acs., on W. side of a Reedy Marsh, 2
br. of Chukatuck; adj. Jerri, Rétter, &
land of Jno. Turner. &c; 29 Oct. 1696,
p. 64. 400 acs. granted Richd. & Miles
Lewis, 29 Jan. 1667, who sold to Mr.
Robt. Coleman; 130 acs. within the
bounds; granted to sd, Coleman, 20
Apr. 1684, deserted, & now granted by
order, &c. Imp. of 11 pers.*

THOMAS MILLNER & JNO. MILLNER, sons of Col. Tho. Millner,
dec'd; 734 acs., Up. Par. of Nansemond Co; on both sides of Wickham
Swamp; 29 Oct. 1696, p. 65. Beg. by
Wickham Roade, a cor. of the Parish
land; &c. Imp. of 15 pers: Jane, Moll,
Bess, Peter, Jack, Hector, Kate, Harry,
Congo, Tom, Sipio, Betty, Moll, Robo;
& Jno. Taylor.

JOHN BEVILL, 225 acs., in Appamatock River, in Bristoll Par., on the
head of land called the Old Town; 29
Oct. 1696, p. 66. Granted to Anne
Butler, mother of the patentee, 29 Sept.
1664, deserted, & now granted by order,
&c. Imp. of 5 pers.* Note: In Chas.
City Co.

THO. MURRELL, 1538 acs., Chas.
City Co., 29 Oct. 1696, p. 66. 850
acs. granted him, 16 Feb. 1663; 688
acs., being the King’s land, beg. on
Seller Run; crossing Collings’ Run; to
Mr, Bray; up Naman’s Run & Popler
Branch. Imp. of 14. pers: Mich.
Hamon, Jno. Randall, Wm. Pamfeild,
Sus. Daniel, Martin Nutsell (?), Pr.
Prox, Nich, Prox, Simon, Mary, & Rebecka Reveley; Lovedge Clark, David
Sale (?), Hen. James.

MR. RICHARD COCK, 975 acs.,
Chas. City Co; on N. side of James
River, 29 Oct. 1696, p. 67. Beg. at
Mr. Jno. Turner on Chicchomany Path;
to place nnown by the name of the
Arrow Reedes; up Fishing Run; on
line supposed to be of Robt, Peake; to
Tho. Murrell, &c. Imp. of 20 pers:
Danl. Carr, Jno. Gocdman, Susana &
Nicholas Lipscome, Wm. White; & 15
Negroes. *

COL. WM. BYRD, 5644 acs., Hentico Co; on S. side of James River, 29
Oct. 1696, p. 68. Beg. at land of Walter Clatworthy; crossing 3 branches, to
Elam’s path; crossing falling Cr., & a
br. of Pockashock Br; to his former
survey, &c. Imp. of 113 pers: Wm.
Thompson, Saml. Oulton (or Outton),
Eliz. Johnson, Eliz, Morris, Tho. Waterson, Tho. Jonagan, Dennis Collaugh,
Oneal McDonnel, Saml, Sisero, Joan
Sisero, Susen Allaby, Sarah Tonsy, John
Williams; & 100 Negroes.*

MATHEW BRANCH, 50 acs., Hem
rico Co., 29 Oct. 1696, p. 70. Escheated
from Wm. Jones, dec’d., by inquisition.
under Wm. Randolph, Esqr., Esch’r., &
now granted, &c.

CAPT. WILLIAM. RANDOLPH,
2926 acs., Chas. City Ce. in Weynoake
Par; on Pigeon Sw., on S: side of James
River, 15 Oct. 1696, p. 71. Imp. of 59
pers.*

WILLIAM RANDOLPH; Gent., of
Henrico Co. in Virginia, for diverse
gcod causes, &c., have freely delivered
up &c., for myself & my heires &c.,
unto his Majestie, King William, the
pattent granted me, 25 Oct. 1695 for
2926 acs., &c. Signed: William Randolph. In presence of: Robt. Beverley
& Hugh Davis. p. 72,
Att a General Court held at James
City, 15 Oct. 1696 William Randolph
came in to Court & acknowledged the
above surrender, &c. Test: Robt. Beverley, Cl. Gen. Ct.
‘COL, EDWARD HILL, 5060 acs.,
K. & Q. Co; far up in the freshes of
Pamunkey River; 25 Oct. 1695, p. 73.
Beg. in line of Col. William Claybourne, taken in behalfe of one of his
children, upon the bank of the river;
to Hill’s Cr., &c. Imp. of 102 pers.*
The above patent surrendered to King
William, 28 Oct. 1696; p. 74. Witnesses: Cha. Scarburg & Wm. Randolph. Acknowledged at a Gen. Ct.
at James City the same day. Testes
Robt. Beverley, Cl. Gen, Cr.

RALPH WORMLEY, ESQR., Secretary of Virginia; 13,500 acs., K. & Q.
Co., in Pamonky Neck; adj. Page’s
land; on Goodwin’s Cr; on Pounce’s
Cr; adj. Dabney's, Langston & Capt.
Bassett; 25 Oct. 1695, p. 75. Imp. of
270 pers.* Surrendered as above noted.
Witnesses: Benj. Lillingston & Wm.
Harrison.
Ralph Wormely, Esqr., of Middlesex
Co., appointed Mr. Bartholl. Fowler,
of Henrico Co., his true & lawful
Atturney, to appear in the next Genll.
Court at James City & acknowledge to
his Majestie, King William, a deed or
surrender of the above patent, &c.
Witnesses: Benj. Lellingston & Wm.
Harrison. Teste: Robt. Beverley, Cl.
Gen. Ct. 9 Oct. 1696. Page 76.

EDWARD JENINGS, ESQR., 570

THOMAS KING, 70 acs., Warwick
